title: := always make new variable in different blocks?
body:
by **zhaihj233**: 
In golang spec:
 Redeclaration does not introduce a new variable; it just assigns a new value to the original.

What steps will reproduce the problem?

http://play.golang.org/p/YU5p58cf48

What is the expected output?

we have define the variable: err, so I expected:

1.3
6666.6666
strconv.ParseFloat: parsing "aA": invalid syntax

What do you see instead?

1.3
6666.6666
<nil>

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

go version devel +aa5d9f234a8e Mon Dec 24 21:06:57 2012 +0400 darwin/amd64
